content.attribute: Trash bins are lifted into the washing position by a lift.
The inside of the bin is blasted with hot water.
During the cleaning process, the operator uses a hand-held, high pressure washer to clean the exterior and the lid.
All waste water is collected and filtered by us (so no worries about it getting in your yard, driveway or down the drain).
Believe it or not, it actually takes a very small amount of water to thoroughly clean & sanitize each unit (if you did the cleaning yourself, you'd use about 27 gallons each time!).
Believe it or not, it actually takes a very small amount of water to thoroughly clean & sanitize each unit (if you did the cleaning yourself, you'd use about 27 gallons each time!).
The process used automated and fully contained, so no run-off enters the storm drains or your yard.

content.value: How do I know when to put my bins out?
content.attribute: Please leave your trash & recycle bins out after your regular pick-up day, so when we come by (within 24 hours of the regular pick-up) the bins are ready and waiting to be cleaned!
Bacteria such as Salmonella, Listeria, Staphylococcus, and E-Coli aren't just on the inside...that stuff is on the lid & handle too! Contact us today to get rid of all bacteria!

content.value: What if I need to reschedule?
content.attribute: Just let us know at least a week in advance and we will be in contact with you within 24 hours to reschedule
